languageName.description: The name of the language. This will be used to display the language in the language selection menu.

fileExtensions.description: The file extensions that will be associated with this language.

mainGrammarPath.description: The relative path to the main grammar file. This file will be used to generate default syntax highlighting rules.

grammar.description: The syntax highlighting rules for the language. These rules will be used to generate the syntax highlighting rules for the language.

createLanguageConfigurationFile.description: Whether or not to create a language configuration file. This file will be used to specify helpful information about the language, such as comments, brackets, auto closing pairs, etc.

highlightNumbers.description: Whether or not to highlight numbers.

highlightStrings.description: Whether or not to highlight strings.

highlightCharacters.description: Whether or not to highlight characters.

type.description: A block (or multiline) comment in the language. Rather than having a values property, this type has a start and end property. The start property is the text that starts the block comment and the end property is the text that ends the block comment.

oneOf.description: A single line comment in the language.
A constant in the language. Examples include true, false, null, etc.
A built-in function in the language. Examples include print, println, etc.
A keyword in the language. Examples include if, else, while, etc.
An operator in the language. Examples include +, -, *, etc.
A punctuation mark in the language. Examples include (, ), {, }, etc.
A separator in the language, used to separate multiple values but is not applied at the end of the last one. The most common example of this is a comma.
A string in the language. This is typically used to surround text and is applied at the beginning and end of every string. The most common example of this is double quotes.
A terminator in the language. This is typically used to terminate a statement and is applied at the end of every statement. The most common example of this is a semicolon.
A type in the language. Examples include int, float, string, etc.
